headline.main: Why the Fashion World Is Obsessed With ‘RuPaul’s Drag Race’
headline.print_headline: Strutting Into the Hearts of Fashion Pros

docs.snippet: The reality show pits would-be “drag superstars” against each other in a campy contest. No wonder the fashion industry can’t stop watching....
docs.lead_paragraph: The reality show pits would-be “drag superstars” against each other in a campy contest. No wonder the fashion industry can’t stop watching.

headline.main: Global Efforts Against Ivory Traffickers Still Falling Short
headline.print_headline: Global Efforts Against Ivory Traffickers Still Falling Short

docs.snippet: Poaching syndicates shipped large amounts of African elephant ivory last year despite global calls to dismantle the trafficking networks that often collude with corrupt officials, conservationists said as an international wildlife conference opene...
docs.lead_paragraph: Poaching syndicates shipped large amounts of African elephant ivory last year despite global calls to dismantle the trafficking networks that often collude with corrupt officials, conservationists said as an international wildlife conference opened Saturday in South Africa.

docs.lead_paragraph: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said a revival of a ceasefire in Syria depends on all sides involved and not only on "Russia's unilateral concessions".

headline.main: Syrian Observatory: 25 Killed in Aleppo Attacks on Saturday

docs.lead_paragraph: A Syrian government offensive on rebel-held areas of eastern Aleppo killed at least 25 people on Saturday, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported.

headline.main: Anti-Brexit Group Challenges UK Government Over Article 50 Disclosure
headline.print_headline: Anti-Brexit Group Challenges UK Government Over Article 50 Disclosure

docs.snippet: A group opposed to Britain's exit from the European Union has accused the government of refusing to allow it to make public the official justification for triggering Article 50 to start the Brexit process without a parliamentary vote....
docs.lead_paragraph: A group opposed to Britain's exit from the European Union has accused the government of refusing to allow it to make public the official justification for triggering Article 50 to start the Brexit process without a parliamentary vote.

headline.main: U.S. Police Killings Reminiscent of Lynching, U.N. Group Says
headline.print_headline: U.S. Police Killings Reminiscent of Lynching, U.N. Group Says

docs.snippet: Police killings of black people in the United States are reminiscent of lynchings and the government must do far more to protect them, a United Nations working group says in a report that will be debated at the U.N. Human Rights Council on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Police killings of black people in the United States are reminiscent of lynchings and the government must do far more to protect them, a United Nations working group says in a report that will be debated at the U.N. Human Rights Council on Monday.

headline.main: Syrian Government Forces Seize Aleppo Camp From Rebels: Monitor, Rebel, State TV
headline.print_headline: Syrian Government Forces Seize Aleppo Camp From Rebels: Monitor, Rebel, State TV

docs.snippet: Syrian government forces captured a rebel-held area north of Aleppo on Saturday, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, a rebel official, and a state-run TV station reported....
docs.lead_paragraph: Syrian government forces captured a rebel-held area north of Aleppo on Saturday, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, a rebel official, and a state-run TV station reported.

headline.main: Syrian Troops Advance in Aleppo Amid War's Heaviest Bombing
headline.print_headline: Syrian Troops Advance in Aleppo Amid War's Heaviest Bombing

docs.snippet: Syrian troops captured a rebel-held area on the edge of Aleppo on Saturday, tightening their siege on opposition-held neighborhoods in the northern city after what residents described as the heaviest air bombardment of the 5 ½-year civil war....
docs.lead_paragraph: Syrian troops captured a rebel-held area on the edge of Aleppo on Saturday, tightening their siege on opposition-held neighborhoods in the northern city after what residents described as the heaviest air bombardment of the 5 ½-year civil war.
